content.description: This route is actually located on the Big Pine Towers, a bit uphill and a bit north of the actual Rupley Towers.  This follows an obvious finger crack in front of a small tree to a set of chain anchors.  Its short but sweet -- the crux is placing the bomber pro while never being fully comfortable with where your feet are.  Photos can be found atclimbaz.com.
content.protection: Mostly small nuts down low.  Several placements for green/yellow Alien sized cams up higher.  This route eats up passive pro.  Chain anchors.

climbs.name: The Sloth
climbs.fa: Lisa Rehms, Eric Fazio-Rhicard, John Fowler

content.description: A fun bouldery start with some powerful moves.  A little short, as it leaves you wanting more and tends to ease off pretty qickly.  The crux was down low.
content.location: This is the first climb to the left of Recovery Room.

content.description: Crux is about midway, and requires a right-foot high-step/rockover/mantle for most. Otherwise, good moderate Lemmon face climbing. Holds aren't all huge but they're positive.
content.protection:
Bolts (6? But count for yourself, they should all be visible from the ground). Anchor: long chains.

 Bolts and top-anchors updated by CASA in 2016.
content.location: Southwest-facing buttress. A house-sized boulder is very close to the base, forming a chasm with the route (it's easy to scramble up this boulder for some nice views of climbers on this route and the surrounding area).

content.description: Fun climbing on good edges with a slabby section at the end.
content.location: Facing the wall it is the third climb to the left, just to the left of The Sloth.

content.description: This route is actually located on the Big Pine Towers, a bit uphill and a bit north of the actual Rupley Towers.  This route is the bolted line to the left of Wicked Indecency.  The first bolt is up pretty high on 5.8+ climbing.  You can place a Black Alien below the bolt, but as I have seen it pop under body weight -- I wouldn't want to fall on it.  Expect to see a new first bolt added soon to make it safer.
content.protection: 3 Bolts, Chain Anchors, and a sketchy Black Alien in a vertical seam below the first bolt.

content.description: Balancy start to a hard bulge.
content.location: On the up hill side of Big Pine Towers left of the Sloth on the next tower about 75 feet up the hill.  Climbs the blunt arete.

content.description: The Big Pine Towers are a group of short towers in the Rupley Tower area.  If you can climb hard enough, there are routes on both sides that will let you chase sun or shade.  These towers have mostly hard routes, but there are several short, sustained moderate routes as well.
